website_summaries.verdict: The Bowers & Wilkins PX7 headphones balance strong wireless noise cancellation with excellent audio performance for a very high price.
pros: Powerful audio performance with rich bass depth and sculpted highs
App allows ambient levels to be mixed in with ANC
Can be used in wired mode
cons: ANC is quite good, but not best in class
Sculpted sound signature isn't for everyone

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the PX and not as good as the competition
customer_reviews.text: I loved the original pair, the PX, but these just don't measure up. The design is better and they're lighter, meaning they're more comfortable. But there just not as good as the competition. I have in fact just exchanged them for a pair of Sony WH1000M3 which I'll say do measure up. Significantly cheaper, punchier, better bass and all round clarity. The PX7s are good but not great & certainly not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: Not having anything wrong with my previous P5's other than now permanently plugged in to the computer for the kids to game with, decided it was time for a wireless upgrade . I assure you these are awesome. The sound is amazing and battery life is long enough for two long haul flights. The packaging is exactly where and what you'd expect with Bowers and Wilkins. Connectivity with the app is top notch and auto cut off/pause when lifting a cup should you have to communicate with someone is awesome. My only small gripe is that they don't fold up as compact as my others but this is forgivable as the build is so tough. Recomended despite the price
customer_reviews.author: igar1971

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancelling??? Really???
customer_reviews.text: Ok so they are bowers & Wilkins so you expect good sound and on this they deliver. Maybe a little too heavy on the bass side but perfectly listenable. These are however advertised as noise cancelling, they most certainly are not! There is absolutely zero difference between low, auto or high..,,NONE!!! Seriously if you want an ok pair of headphones just to listen to music these will do the job but if you want ANY level of ANC ... look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: KDJ

customer_reviews.title: Just incredible sound
customer_reviews.text: I love these. Sound quality is incredible and really versatile. Does feel a bit like your head is in a vice but totally worth it and still allows hours of listening. After doing lots of research, I went for these over the Bose equivalent. The trade off seeming to be Bose with better noise cancelling but bowers with better sound quality. Pleased to say that the noise cancelling is incredible too!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Superb sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I still own the previous PX's, which I've never been too impressed with, so when B&W announced this new replacement model, I was happy and a little fearful. Having already sent back a pair of the Sony XM3's, which were decent but not all that great, I wasn't sure if these would be any better. Well, I was so wrong. These are what the PX's should have sounded like to begin with. So musical, so clear, so rich and full. They really are the most enjoyable headphones to listen to. They're also super comfortable and much lighter. Brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: McF

customer_reviews.title: Bit disappointed with these
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long term B&W fan and have the old P7 wireless and a full B&W home cinema set up. I bought these to replace some B&O H7's wireless which had a cable fault. To my ears the PX7's have an unbalanced tonal set up. The treble is too forward/harsh and bass is over boosted. Strange because many Hi-Fi magazines really rate them and I'm running them on a Chord Mojo with variety of audio sources, including some Hi-Def. Maybe they just need running in a bit longer. Too late now but I'd send them back if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Tricky6

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Bought these mainly to use with my astell & kern ak70 DAP with which they sound brilliant. I have also found them useful for watching films on my TV and don't want to annoy the nieghbours You can't adjust the sound from the app but B&W have got it spot on so it doesn't matter. Bass is full but tight, midrange is just about open enough but very detailed, while the treble is sweet and extended Brilliant bluetooth headphones
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. G. A. Goodale

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: Tried the very latest comparable from the following manufacturers before choosing these: Dali, Sony, Shure. Dali were very good but lacked a sense of space, good build quality and comfort. Sony sounded too artificial and felt cheap. Shure...amazing build quality, terrible sound total lack of depth and space. These for a bluetooth set of cans are very, very impressive. 😎
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Brown

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed, but I have ordered another pair to give it another try
customer_reviews.text: So, I really, really wanted to love these. I've had them for a month and have ordered a replacement pair. I first encountered issues after a week but was able to troubleshoot and solve it. The sound is amazing, the noise-cancelling is pretty good (good enough for me anyway), but I have lost sound in one ear, and as of today, the other is dropping off and pausing the music automatically. Strange behaviour in any case. I hope the replacement pair doesnt have the same issues.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful sound and great fit
customer_reviews.text: A gorgeous pair of headphones. Great sound and comfortable even for extended periods of use. Important for me is that they are genuinely over eat as other headphones that press even s little on my ears get painful after a couple of hours. A few software glitches, particularly with the wear sensor not triggering, but I'm guessing there will be updates. Overall I think I've found the right headphones that really work for me.
customer_reviews.author: D. Carboni

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: These extremely overpriced headphones are ok in terms of comfort however absolutely unbearable if you wear glasses. The sound quality is shocking, they sound muffled, the bass is weak and if you like your music loud, it will sound very distorted and high pitched. The volume buttons are hard to reach and are easily mistaken by either the power button or the pause/play button as they’re all on top of each other. Noise cancellation works fine though it could be better. However, if you want to get these just for the NC don’t do it. Get a pair that actually sounds good too.
customer_reviews.author: Diogo Cavadas

customer_reviews.title: Great reproduction of sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bowers and Wilkins have always produced excellent quality speakers and headphones over many years. The sound quality is exceptional, and build quality is way above the average. If you like good sound production from your headphones, then this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: fed1615

customer_reviews.title: Good natural sound. Comfortable ..faults developing
customer_reviews.text: Better than PX. Lighter (not much) less bulky and carbon fibre looks and feels cool. Good build quality. Comfortable. Natural sound. Good separation. Updated 10 months later .. annoying faults developing saying “ second device connected/ disconnected “. Will seek solution under warrant so let’s see
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Musical Joy
customer_reviews.text: Are they perfect, no they're not. Do they transmit joy, yes. Too much can be said of technical capabilities, can these be beaten for accuracy - yes. However given proper quality source material they convey pure joy. Which is the whole point, no matter you're own preference is; they will make you smile. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: DannyJ

customer_reviews.title: Superb headphones
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality and well built. Bowers and Wilkins are a proper hifi company and make some of the best loudspeakers money can buy, you can literally hear their decades of experience. Plus if you buy these, you support an expert British company.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Very Enjoyable Headphones... issue after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, ANC etc. Very happy with the headphones until the audio from the left ear cup stopped after ~2 months of use. Could hear some crackling, but no audio. Sent for repair, and this problem should be resolved. The issue seems to be due to the build quality/quality control.
customer_reviews.author: welly

customer_reviews.title: Quality NC Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great Bluetooth Noise-cancelling headphones. Haven't been able to try them on a flight yet, to really test the comfort, but they don't seem to be as comfortable as my old AKG over-ear headphones. Hence only 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional!
customer_reviews.text: Always balked at paying the far side of £300 for premium headphones, these at £229 and payments over five months were too good to pass up. Very comfortable. Sound is exceptional. Detail and definition a definite step up from my current mid range Sennheisers. You will hear the difference. All the detail is there even at sensible volumes. They take you an appreciable step closer to the music.
customer_reviews.author: Neill

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones making life at home 🙌
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones absolutely sublime audio quality and brilliant noise cancellation. Both rock and electronic music sound amazing 4 stars only one knocked off due to some minor issues with Bluetooth devices connectivity not always being 100 percent linked into the device app . This does not detract from the sound quality or overall quality of the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wiggle

customer_reviews.title: Faulty
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is amazing, comfort is good. However the "wear sensors" don't seem to work, they did a couple of time when I first got these headphones, but not anymore. As for the noise cancellation, I don't think that works either as I can't hear a difference between on or off? I would like a replacement pair, but can't figure out how to do that, without returning these, then ordering a new pair at full price..........?
customer_reviews.author: Jem

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: fantastic headphones. You get what you pay for and these are first class. Only slight gripe is lack of equaliser on app. But hopefully an update for the future
customer_reviews.author: caldabhoy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, comfortable for long periods.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound and Bluetooth stability, can connect 2 devices and has a dedicated Android app. Spacious ear cups, with a robust hard zipcase. Really good microphone, good audio quality from other people's reports on MS Teams.
customer_reviews.author: kindlefan

customer_reviews.title: heavy & uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: sound 7 features were fantastic but too heavy and found very uncomfortable to wear. i gave them a month to see if it would improve, I could wear my bose qc35s for hours in comfort. have returned & replaced with bose 7000's which were very comortable out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: bazza

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sound
customer_reviews.text: I do very much like the B&W sound. This is also one of the first noise-canceling headphones where I do not seem to 'hear' the noise-canceling. It does not cancel enormously: you can still hear some background noise (when you're not playing music).
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kennis

customer_reviews.title: Good level of detail and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Happy so far. Not tested the noise cancelling function outside the home yet. I wear glasses and arm do get in the way and impact the fit but you will have this issue with all over the ear cans. I use when sound quality is important. For comfort I go back to AirPods.
customer_reviews.author: North Londoner

customer_reviews.text: Perfect - service, product and price 10/10 thank you so much
customer_reviews.author: y c.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I received my new PX7 today. However left hand side cap play music intermittently and with cracking noise. As a big fan of B&W brand this comes as massive disappointment. Immediately asked Amazon for like for like product replacement however this option was not offered hence opted for full refund. I wouldn't expect such hassle with product costing almost £300.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones, the noise cancellation is awesome, people I’m chatting to will tell the cat wants to go out as I can’t hear it. Connectivity is great with the laptop and the iPhone. I suffer from tinnitus and the background sounds come in handy. Certainly worth the cost but the split payments help!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Try

customer_reviews.title: Best headset I've had
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many headsets, had the PX before this. This is an improvement in terms of weight and sound quality. For the price, about the best sound you'll find out there. Many thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Nugget McNuggetface

customer_reviews.title: Best microphone on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best microphone on the market for a wireless speaker. Unlike all the other wireless headphones Great sound quality too. Durability is the only down side. As these do not fold, you need to always find a way to keep them safe and protected. My pair unfortunately snapped in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: O. Adeboye

customer_reviews.title: Best Wireless Noise Cancelling Headphones EVER
customer_reviews.text: I've tried Bose, I've tried Sony, I've tried Sennheiser... Bowers & Wilkins blow them ALL out the water in terms of sound quality and comfort....add on 30 hour battery life... Happy Days ! :-)
customer_reviews.author: A. Macaulay

customer_reviews.title: Left earphone not working.
customer_reviews.text: I was really very disappointed. Looks like that price and quality is two different things. In a first two minutes I damage my mood. I don't know what to say - is this earphones good or not? Bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: Gatis

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: I love Bowers & Wilkins products. These headphones are a little bigger than the PX5's but the sound is really superb. I love them. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: P Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding sound quality extremely comfortable to wear for extended listening and great battery life whats not to love.
customer_reviews.author: dunbok

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancellation option didn't work. After only using it for a few hours the headphones started making a weird buzzing noise. They refused to give me a replacement pair. The costumer service is really bad.
customer_reviews.author: Simona

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, stratospheric. I am hearing my music anew.
customer_reviews.text: Utterly awesome. I had the PX5s but this is a stratospheric step up. I am hearing music new again. It does what it promises and delivers on the Guardian five star review. Check them out.
customer_reviews.author: S. Enright

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and ANC
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones in all aspects. My only negative feedback is that the foam is not ajusting to your ears as well as the did on my P5s.
customer_reviews.author: fArGo

customer_reviews.title: Just wonderful
customer_reviews.text: The most beautiful thing to cup my ears and shoot sound in them.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Awful quality hardware, zero customer support.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THESE HEADPHONES After only a few months of ownership, the headphones snapped whilst I was putting them on my head! There is a weak link attaching the headband to the ear cup, now they are rendered useless. The worst part is the absolutely ATROCIOUS customers service, Amazon will not take any responsibility and they point you to the manufacturer, Bowers and Wilkins make it impossible for you to contact them, therefore I'm now stuck with a $400 paper weight. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh H

customer_reviews.title: Terrible midrange and treble.
customer_reviews.text: Much lighter and more comfortable than their predecessors, the PX, but it sounds like you’re listening to music through a wet blanket. So so so disappointing for a company with the credentials of Bowers & Wilkins. The midrange and treble just sound totally muted and dampened, odd given how their speakers are known for almost too piercing treble with their diamond tweeters. I wouldn’t buy these again knowing how bad the sound quality is. No other features can compensate for the poor audio.
customer_reviews.author: Jack F

customer_reviews.title: Everything you'd expect
customer_reviews.text: I just got my PX7s today I haven't had the chance to try them wireless but the audio wired is clear and crisp the bass feels just right and as an added bonus these are much more comfortable than the original PX headphones. They are a definite improvement over the last ones rest assured.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Strahorn

customer_reviews.title: My Clear Favorite
customer_reviews.text: The sound: Clean, detailed, present. Real buttons: well placed, with good "feel". Large ear cavities for comfort. Connects quickly to Avantree transmitter and does so without button pushing on transmitter. Good customer service trouble-shooting via phone. As others have mentioned, ear pressure is a bit strong (hope for "break-in"}. And receiving range is a bit less than my other headsets with same transmitter. Sound quality worth the $ and slight imperfections. Update: One star off for comfort. After two months, the pressure has not eased. Pity, as clearly the best sound out there. Any tips on correcting this issue?
customer_reviews.author: Fred Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Bitterly Disappointing Sound
customer_reviews.text: I was unpleasantly astonished by the murky and low-volume sound of these PX7 headphones, with or without noise canceling engaged. The sound was so anemic that at first I thought something was wrong with my hearing. Then I tried the same tracks on my earlier P7 phones without touching the volume control, and was rewarded with vivid powerful sound. The P7 totally blew the PX7 away. Perhaps the PX7 is not suitable for my iPhone 11 Pro Max. B&W mentions only a couple of devices that currently support their aptX technology, and the iPhone is not one them. In any case, I have returned the PX7 and chalked this up as a lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford L. Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: NOT NOISE CANCELING!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS SET OF EARPHONES GETS A 3 STAR RATING. BUT FOR BUILD QUALITY, DESIGN AND EASY ON THE EARS IT GETS A 5 STAR RATING. THIS PRODUCT, LIKE THE HIGH END BOSE AND SONY COMPETITORS IS NOT A NOISE CANCELLING SET OF EARPHONES. THEY ARE A NOISE REDUCING SET. THAT IS A HUGE DIFFERENCE. NOISE CANCELING TO ME MEANS IT CUTS OUT ALL AMBIENT SOUND. WITH NOISE CANCELING ON I CAN STILL HEAR PEOPLE TALKING AROUND ME ON ALL THREE MANUFACTURERS EARPHONES. SO, I ASK, ARE ALL THREE MANUFACTURERS USING FALSE ADVERTISIN CLAIMS? IF THEY CAN REDUCE AMBIENT SOUND,, WHY CAN'T THE ELIMINATE IT COMPLLETELY?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best headphones that I have! I have the Bowers & Wilkins PX7, Sennheiser Momentum 3, Sony WH-1000XM3, Sony WH-XB900N, Bose 700, Bose QuietComfort 35 II, and even a Mpow H12. Of all of my headphones, I like the overall sound of the PX7. It has the best soundstage and instrument separation. The Momentum 3 is a very close second!
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Best By Far
customer_reviews.text: I use my noise cancelling earphones with a Sony soundbar/receiver, an iPhone, my classic iPod (which will inevitably wear out, and is hard to replace, so I will be searching for the least expensive receiver that sends a bluetooth signal both directions) and while traveling. I have both current Bose models and have tried Sony. None match these for sound quality and ambient noise reduction. I particularly appreciate the ability to vary the level/type of noise reduction. They are not as light, but they are comfortable. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Edson W. Kempe

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and controls
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great and I'm happy, except.. 1) Noise cancelling, while on a plane at some point it just doesn't block the noise that well until you move your head around and then it seems to catch up again (?) 2) YOU CANNOT USE THEM WIRED WITHOUT TURNING THEM ON. This basically mean that when battery ages they will become pretty much obsolete. It 3) There is no leather anymore... so these are charged premium now without the justification. 4) They fold in a weird almost forced way
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D

customer_reviews.title: Simply astonishing
customer_reviews.text: I love my 20 year old B&W speakers. So I thought I’d give these a go. Wow. What an upgrade from the Bose QC35 IIs and worth every penny. I can wear them comfortably over glasses for 3-4 hours at a time before I need a break. But that fidelity though. It took a few rounds to find the right levels of ambient filter so I could hear myself on conference calls. But it was just a minute. Noise canceling is top notch. I actually really like the auto-on feature when you put them on. Knowing my music will pause and restart is useful.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Harrison

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING SOUND
customer_reviews.text: I don't consider myself to be an audio file or anything like that but these headphones offer absolutely amazing sound. I hear little notes and delicacies in my music that I've never heard before. They have an expansive soundstage that really helps them standout from other headphones in my opinion. They are also VERY comfortable, have a great battery life, and really good feel to them. I would highly recommend these to anyone
customer_reviews.author: winner9898

customer_reviews.title: Too quiet and clicking noises
customer_reviews.text: I love Bower & Wilkins products in general. These headphones are 3rd generation I owned of PX family. These headphones are more comfortable to wear. Unfortunately the last upgrade was not a good one:( They are significantly lower in max volume than previous version of PX. On top of that I hear clicking noises in the right ear. I was hoping it would disappear with software upgrades, but it was just wishful thinking. They still click every second or two and volume is still too low even when connected with a wire to my LG V50 (amazing phone for music listening) . Very disappointing and expensive for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: enemyofthesame

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones I Have Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing and well worth the price. I consider myself an audiophile. I am a professional studio engineer, drummer, and composer. These make all records sound new and amazing. I was planning on returning these if they didn't knock my socks off. They knocked my socks and all of my clothes off. I am listening to them naked and hearing real music the way it was recorded. HIGHLY recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Boo

customer_reviews.title: Cream of the Crop
customer_reviews.text: Best sounding ANC on the market. Had the opportunity to compare all of the leading models in a sound studio with airplane and subway noise piped in. These blew away the competition in terms of sound stage width and clarity across all ranges. Only the Sony had slightly better overall noise cancelling and the Bose 700 were slightly more comfortable. Headphones compared were: Sony WH-1000XM3 Bose ANC 700 Beyerdynamic Lagoon Sennheiser Momentum 3
customer_reviews.author: DogWatcher

customer_reviews.title: Solid HiFi NC Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound stage, depth of bass to treble. I've tried many HiFi NC headphones and these surpass them all (Sennheiser, Sony, M&D, BEO Play, etc.). I listened to music on Tidal HiFi, Qobuz Studio HiFi and iTunes. The over-ear size is heavy after several hours of use. And the noise cancelling in airports, on flights is not that effective.
customer_reviews.author: Nordk Ltd.

customer_reviews.title: Get these
customer_reviews.text: Ok I've been through lots of earphones as Amazon would know I've return alot of head phones and ear phones .I don't think I'll be returning these .I love how these sound the bass the vocals and the trebble it a balance sound stage no joke .I'm really picky what my music sounds in my ears and my ears are in love see for yourself you won't be upset
customer_reviews.author: william delgdo

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a half dozen different noise cancelling headphones and these are hands-down the best. My primary purpose is when I'm competing in billiards tournaments. In these cases, I'm in a room with 35 tables, 200 people talking, music playing in the background, and 35 sets of hard objects hitting each other. These are all dynamic sounds coming intermittently from every possible direction. The PX7s allow me to tune the chaos out and focus solely on my play. On high, I could literally take a nap.
customer_reviews.author: ross r blaising

customer_reviews.title: Liked it
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is really awesome. I've been using bose qc35i for almost an year. After hearing a couple of tracks on these new px7 I thought of putting my qc back on just to see the difference and I was shocked that qc sounded a bit cheap. Only thing that I didn't like in the px7 is they sound a little low in terms of volume. I feel like I'm still a couple of points low on volume. Comfort - excellent Sound quality - excellent Blootooth connectivity - excellent Noise cancelation - excellent Controls - excellent Volume - good
customer_reviews.author: kowshik

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant headphones
customer_reviews.text: Previously I had a chance to use following headphones, Sony wh-1000xm3, Bose QC35, Sennheiser HD559. All these headphones seem like a toy comparing to BW PX7. I find sound quality by far most important feature of any audio system, and PX7 is absolute winner in this field. Rich, detailed, dynamic sound with amazing sound stage. Noise canceling is good, but I must admit it's better on Sony 1000xm3. Battery life also amazing, I forget last time I did a recharge. If I would need one flaw to list, maybe somewhat strange button position on right earcup. It happens many time to press button when taking them off.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Very good overall
customer_reviews.text: I personally liked the fit of these headphones. They fit very snug which is nice when you are working out at the gym because they are less likely to fall off your head. The sound is very true to B&W. You will not get a big "room sound" like you will with the Sony's at a similar price point but what you will get is a very neutral well balanced sound that reproduces the sound very accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: The best sound, build quality, and battery life
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many different high end headphones and earbuds and this one is by far my favorite. The sound quality is awesome! Battery life is wonderful. I have never charged it in the last one and half month. The build quality is also superior compared to many other competitors. The only shortcoming is the mic quality and it is only beaten by bose nc 700, but on par with others.
customer_reviews.author: zhaleh

customer_reviews.title: Premium Build, but Not Premium Comfort, and BAD sound
customer_reviews.text: Build is very good. Looks and feels like a pair of premium headphone. I particularly like the nice fabric on earcups. But the clamping force of the headband is too strong and I don't even have a big head. Sound is mediocre at best. Weakass bass that has zero punchiness with muffled highs. I can't belive there r so many reviewers here or on YouTube saying this is an excellent sounding headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Zhen L.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. But can’t use it for work and music
customer_reviews.text: Very nice functionally and technically. Do a nice job. Large ear pads cover the ears. When connected to the laptop with the usb-c cable you can listen to music but the mic doesn’t work. So you can’t participate in meeting or audio conferences. You can connect using Bluetooth but if you want to use the mic while charging, you cannot. So I returned it because I work remotely and can keep switching headphones for music and calls. Not many headphones do this. I have only seen Shure Aonic50 do this.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: No unnecessary gimmicks here. This headphones in my opinion offers best sound in this price range. The Bose offers more features and is more compact so maybe better for travel but it also looks cheaply made of plastic especially the last model. This headphones are very well-made, little bulky and a volume control could be better however they provide great sound.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful headphones that sound great!
customer_reviews.text: These are great wireless headphones. They pair really easy, sound great, and actually have an app that lets you control the noise cancelling, the paired devices (can support 2 devices at once). The app also has a built in white noise generator with different ambient soundscapes. The USB C charging is a great addition as well!
customer_reviews.author: Thanatos

customer_reviews.title: Good improvement from PX
customer_reviews.text: PX7s are lighter than PX and has deeper bass than PXs and overall better sound signature to my preference. If I’m being nitpicking, the buttons have better craftsmanship on PXs than PX7.
customer_reviews.author: Ralf

customer_reviews.title: Love the Sound
customer_reviews.text: The PX7's are very much as described in most reviews. The sound is great, not punchy. Noise reduction is good, but certainly not exceptional. I continue to try to stretch the headband since it doe feel a bit tight... I don't know if can be done, though. Overall I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Haley

customer_reviews.title: Great quality sound with the correct bluetooth drivers on Windows 10 desktop
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased these headphones, I was really disappointed listening to WAV files with Windows Media Player on my Windows 10 desktop, the volume would fade in and out. I thought to myself this cant be right, so I tested on my laptop running Windows 10 but it did not have the same problem. Solution was to update to the correct bluetooth drivers from the manufacturer and not use the generic bluetooth drivers that Windows 10 supplied. These headphone exceeded my expectations, I would recommend to anyone. Solid product. Noise cancelling is also great
customer_reviews.author: Dean A. Mills

customer_reviews.title: These headphones sound great, until the static starts
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these headphones since December, and while they fit great, and sound great to my ears most of the time, the have one glaring flaw. They have an underlying static that comes and goes. I can't nail it down to any one type of music, but it won't go away, even after resetting the headphones repeatedly, and using four different sources to drive them. Doesn't matter whether noise cancelling is high, low, auto, or off. Very disappointing. Add to this the fact that I've been ghosted by B&W support, and I'm really not happy with my experience.
customer_reviews.author: J Lindeman

customer_reviews.title: The best Bluetooth cans on the market
customer_reviews.text: The soundstage in these headphones are incredible. I would never expect headphones less than $600 to sound this good. I am very happy with the volume, even over Bluetooth, not sure why people are complaining about that. These are definitely my favorite Bluetooth headphones. The full range is clear, the bass isn’t overwhelming, and THE SOUNDSTAGE! So good! Love love love these. I hope they last longer than my PXC 550s.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money, but.....
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality and build were quite good, but two things kept this from being a five star review: 1. Clamping force was a little too tight and made listening for extended periods of time a bit of a chore. 2. Control app required enabling of location services on your device (phone or tablet) in order to work properly. Wasn’t comfortable keeping it on full time, so I wound up turning it off after making any adjustments.
